Package faulty

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BoolExp  
    Code
    A simple interface that provides the basic specification of any code, getBDD is the main methods that returns the BDD representation of the Code implemented by Assign, and MultAssign
    Expression
    A basic interface that provides the basic description of an expression, Implemented by: BoolExp, IntExp, etc
    IntExp
    An interface of Integer Expressions
    Var  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AndBoolExp
    A class to represent the "and" of two boolean expressions
    AuxiliarChannel  
    AuxiliarChannelCollection  
    AuxiliarMain  
    AuxiliarProcess  
    AuxiliarProcessCollection  
    AuxiliarProcessDecl  
    AuxiliarVar  
    BiimpBoolExp
    A class to represent the "and" of two boolean expressions
    BoolChanAccess
    A class that represent the access to a BoolChannel, for instance, x := chan.get() the left part is a Chan Access, used as an expression in left part of assignaments
    BoolChanAssign
    A class that represents an assignation to a channel, that is, a value is put into the channel.
    BoolChannel
    A simple class modelling the behavior of bool channel by means of using BDDs the channel is modeled in the following way: el_n -> el_n-1 -> ... -> el_0 The elements are stored in an array els, being els_ used for storing their primed versions, array oc (and oc_) serve for indicating if an given position of the channel is occupied or not.
    Branch
    Models a branch of a process of the style: Guard -> Command it contains a reference to its process, a guard and a code, the code to be executed when the guard is true
    Channel
    Abstract class for channels.
    ConsBoolExp
    A class that represents a boolean constant, it could be true or false, represented by a constant BDD
    ConsIntExp
    A class representing an integer constant
    DivIntExp
    A class that implements the division between two integers: int1 / int2 TO BE IMPLEMENTED, DO NOT USE
    EqBoolExp
    A class that implements the boolean expresion int1 = int2
    GreaterBoolExp
    Class implementing the comparation int1 > int2
    IntChanAccess
    A class representing the access to an Int channel.
    IntChanAssign
    A class that represents an assignation to an Int channel, that is, a value is put into the channel.
    IntChannel  
    LessBoolExp
    This class implements the comparation int1 < int2
    ListAssign
    A class the implements code and represents a multiple assignment
    MultIntExp
    Class representing the multiplication of two UNSIGNED integers: int1 * int2 TO BE IMPLEMENTED, DO NOT USE
    NegBoolExp
    A class that represent the negation of a boolean expression
    NegIntExp
    Class representing the subtraction of two integers: exp1 - exp2 The result is stored in an array of bits (BDD) Note that this operation in for UNSIGNED Ints,then no negative numbers are used We use a complement method to calculate the subtraction, using the implemented sum, more efficient (in space) methods need to be implemented
    OrBoolExp  
    Process
    Process is a basic class to capture the behavior of a process, it contains the basic information of a process: a list of vars, the channels used, etc.
    Program
    This class defines a FAULTY program, it provides the basic structures: a list of channels, separating in bool and int channels, and a factory to construct the BDD's correspondong to the program.
    SumIntExp
    Provides the basic behavior of an expression adding two integers
    TestProgram
    A simple class to test the faulty program language
    VarAssign
    A class representing an assignation to a var: var := Expr it implements the interface code
    VarBool  
    VarInt
    This class implements the basics for UNSIGNED integer variables the class SInteger, provides the behavior ofr signed integers, by implementation unsigned integers use less BDD vars, thus are more amenable for symbolic model checking.
